title: Deil's Cauldron Walk Route

images.title: Bill Clark / River Lednock
images.caption: River Lednock. The River Lednock flows steeply from the Deil's Cauldron and then over another series of waterfalls at the Little Deil's Cauldron.

images.title: Bill Clark / Little Deil's Cauldron, River Lednock
images.caption: Little Deil's Cauldron. A cascade several hundred metres south of the Deil's Cauldron, with many interesting ledges and potholes. By-passed by the main path.

images.title: Walking in Laggan Wood, near Comrie by Anthony O'Neil, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Walking in Laggan Wood, near Comrie

images.title: Viewing Platform at Deil's Caldron by G Laird, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Viewing Platform at Deil's Caldron

images.title: Dr Richard Murray / Glen Lednock
images.caption: Glen Lednock. This part of the glen is steep-sided and lined with oak and birch woods; the River Lednock is just out of sight below. Lord Melville's Monument is visible on the left on the summit of Dun More. Patchy snow is still present on Creag na h-Iolaire (Eagles Crag) in the distance.

images.title: A walk through the treetops in Laggan Wood by Anthony O'Neil, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A walk through the treetops in Laggan Wood

images.title: Pete Chapman, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View over valley of River Earn Walk above Comrie from Monument near The Milton, Comrie. The monument (behind the photographer) is situated on a locally prominent rocky knoll. The knoll had a thin screen of trees, but a clear grassy top. View looking W.

description: This walk visits Deil's Cauldron waterfall in Comrie in Perth and Kinross. You can reach the falls by following a footpath north through Laggan Wood and along the River Lednock from Comrie. The falls are an impressive sight with a cascading waterfall and several pools below resembling a boiling cauldron. On the western side of the river there's also the climb to the Melville Monument where you can enjoy some wonderful views over the area. To continue your walking around Comrie head west along the St Fillans to Comrie Railway Path to visit Loch Earn. There's a splendid viewpoint here and the Lochearnhead to St Fillans Railway Walk to try as well.
display_address: A85, Dalginross, Comrie, Perth and Kinross, Alba / Scotland, PH6 2EA, United Kingdom
